Reviews.Title: Works as intended
Reviews.Author: Crump
Reviews.Content: Works as intended i have no complaints, works for usa phone carrier "straight talk" no problems what so ever.Good purchase.

Reviews.Title: It has Hebrew preinstalled!
Reviews.Author: Nussbacher
Reviews.Content: I live in Israel and bought the phone on the whim of the moment bacause the kevlar, the battery and price. Only after I paid I realized that I might have a problem with the system language and with OTA updates to the ICS. Well, there was nothing I could do and I prepared myself for the worst scenario - starting to Google how to install Hebrew on the device and how to manually update. You can imagine the nice surprise when I opened the box and discovered it has Hebrew as one of the preinstalled languages. The strange thing is - that this specific phone is not sold in Israel and is not advertised on the Israeli web site of Motorola. It is actually made for Malaisya! Then,I had something else to worry about - will I receive the Android update to 4.04 like anybody else??After about one week - I received the notification, downloaded and updated.Stupid but lucky!

Reviews.Title: WORST SELLER on Amazon
Reviews.Author: Mir
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone as international gift and they sent the wrong phone. Phone box had clearly written Razr maxx but actually it was XT910 8GB Spyder version. I had paid money for Motorola Razr Maxx 16GB 3300mAh battery phone. After opening box it was found that LCD was having a DOT in it. Secondly speaker and mic were not working properly.Thank God after loads of email they returned extra paid amount. I wont suggest anyone to buy from this seller. Motorola XT910 has issues like lcd burn issue and wifi death grip issue. We got Asian version of this phone which wont be getting Jelly Bean update. Android ICS 4.0 is not stable mostly you'll get app crashes messages.Regretting since that day when i ordered this phone as its a piece of crap.

Reviews.Title: Doesnt work for all carriers
Reviews.Author: Heather Toot "Heather Toot"
Reviews.Content: This phone arrived as described. Works well with straight talk (only complain is that it's a little slow & lags when watching videos) but it does NOT work with AT&T;! I had to buy a new phone for use with AT&T; & this one can only be used on straight talk :/

Reviews.Title: WARNING: ITEMS PURCHASED BY THIS COMPANY WILL ***NOT*** HAVE ANY TYPE OF MANUFACTURER'S WARRANTY!
Reviews.Author: Der Konig
Reviews.Content: READ THIS BEFORE BUYING ANYTHING FROM THIS COMPANY (NEW GENERATION PRODUCTS LLC)  Below is correspondence between myself (customer) and this seller (NGP)  This Company literally told me in the following e-mails, to NOT trust the product description they provided, and that IT IS MY DUTY AS THE CUSTOMER TO VERIFY IN THE FIRST 30 DAYS THAT WE'RE NOT FRAUDING YOU!------------- Begin message -------------Hello Thomas,You bring good point, and I would gladly give you full refund or exchange for new one with hassle free exchange/refund 100% guranteed, however you need to contact us in the first 30 days after you got the item delivered to you, that is the policy with amazon.com. Mistakes happen sometimes and it may be a technician by mistake put used, previously owned unit in the spot where new one should be. This needs to be resolved in first 30 days even if it is our fault, that is why there is 30 days policy, plenty of time to find out what condition item came in, new or used, dont you agree? As far as I know, without investigation those units were Brand New and we have confirmation for Motorola or Amazon, if unit's software was updated or reinstalled that does not make unit used, and I have seen that happen, because some phones that we buy are coming from Motorola of Hong Kong or London, UK. Motorola may not cover it, but it does not make unit used! Also, as far as I know there is no policy on all items being sold having 1 year warranty with Motorola Manufactory unless you buy from channels such as T-Mobile or AT&T;, Verizon or Sprint, so assuming it will have warranty based on a reason it does not say in the listing "No Warranty" is really just an assumption. We only gurantee what listing offers + 30 days amazon warranty, since we do match amazon warranty.Thank you!-TanyaNGP Team--- Original message ---Dear NGP team,  1, Feb, 2013  There seems to be some confusion as to what the issues may be, soI'll gladly tell you the information that was shared with me. After muchtime on the phone with Motorola USA, Motorola Hong Kong, and Amazon.com:  (1) On a recorded conference call with Motorola, Amazon.com, andmyself: Motorola clearly stated that this phone, although marketed as"Brand new", has actually been altered (software) before it's sale to you.Thus, it is no longer considered "Brand new" and will NOT be covered underwarranty.  See, your company sold me a phone that was advertised as a "NEW,Motorola RAZR MAXX," Simple math work would lead me to believe that yourcompany sold me a product under false pretenses, AKA: FALSE ADVERTISING.  (2) Your company WITHHELD VITAL product information that influencesthe decision making process of purchasing this product from you. Whenpurchasing products of this nature and expense, that are marketed as "NEW,"a Manufacturer's warranty is implied unless otherwise disclosed by theseller. NGP did NOT disclose any such information.* A factory Warranty is considered part of the product, unless otherwisestated by you, the seller.  The fact you defend yourself on the basis of OMMITING the fact that thevery expensive products you're marketing as "NEW," don't have warranties isnothing short of disgusting business habits. I'm not too sure Amazon.comwould want to be affiliated with your business practices either. Well, ifthey want to lose customers they'll continue business with you.  Looking forward to resolve,  Thomas P.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Alejandro Aparicio
Reviews.Content: I love it! It already has ICS (Ice cream Sandwich) preinstalled and it came with an hdmi cable. The processor could be better, but as someone else said the battery would drain sooner. It is still a very powerful phone  and it is highly recommended for android’s advanced users.On the other hand the materials used and the design are simply perfect and the battery is great (under intense hours of use it lasted me 24 hrs or more).To sum up I would say that this device is fast, resistant, efficient and the engineering on the design is great.

Reviews.Title: More than expected
Reviews.Author: Asif Ashraf
Reviews.Content: I loved it. It has HDMI out, it has 3300MAh battery, it has HDMI video recording. Android 4.0.x , It has 4.3 inches sharp colored LCD, with very nice and sensitive touch system. It has everything you need.It beats Samsung Galaxy Note II in Batterytime and HD content display. You can plug this to your TV. And anything a latest smartphone should have. It competes with Note II, iPhone5 and any latest droid set very well.

Reviews.Title: Im not happy
Reviews.Author: cottoassan
Reviews.Content: I got the phone and came to Ecuador when I use it, the volumen buttom doesnt work, seems broken.Everything is ok but the buttom is very important for the use

Reviews.Title: poor performance
Reviews.Author: johanb
Reviews.Content: Hotspot did not work.  Reception was very poor. My HTC Amaze was much faster going to websites and fb. Sorry, it was not a good match for using it on T-Mobile network.

Reviews.Title: You will love this phone-If you dont need a hotspot!!!
Reviews.Author: Özgün
Reviews.Content: I am using this phone for a month. The battery is very well. The processor is enough(If you have more powerful cpu, your battery will drain sooner).Everything is ok with the phone but the hotspot feature is not working via usb cable or wireless. The camera doesnt focus as fast as S3 or nexus. but the picture quality is satisfying.You also have 8gb user memory, other 8gb is reserved by phone(not like nexus).

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Eric Plaza
Reviews.Content: Pros. The phone is great,  beautiful and strength design,  feel it hard in the hands (not like cheap plastics phones) and have a plastic rubber in the borders for protections, hardware is enough from my point of view, all program runs ok and never lag. Battery durations is incredible, almost 1 day of hard using (aprx 8 hours of screen on) and still i have a half of charge.Cons. The only that lack the phone is Google play music, I don't know why Motorola don't put in this app.

Reviews.Title: Great battery, disappointed in the camera
Reviews.Author: Tracie L. Mauriello "Tracie Maurie"
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this phone is the battery. It's very good, although it definitely doesn't last as long as advertised, and I'm a person who (usually) remembers to use task killer, to reduce screen brightness, turn off gps, turn off wireless, etc. Still it's better than any other phone I've used so I can't complain.Call quality also seems pretty good so far.The camera, however, is very disappointing. I end up with a hazy blurriness in the middle of every picture. Also, when I set it to "HD" the screen goes very, very dark and the photo comes out very, very dark too, as if I'm shooting in a dark room even when I'm in daylight. I don't get it.This is a problem for me because I am a mobile journalist who takes news photos on the run. My old phone (Samsung Stratosphere) had a much, much better camera. I guess I'll have to go back to carrying a camera in my gear bag again, which I wanted to avoid because it weighs me down. Too bad.Also, when I switched to this phone, Google Voice started acting weird. I never had this trouble with the Stratosphere.Lastly, when I try to sync gmail, which I do several times a day, it takes literally 2-3 minutes for the messages to download. It gets frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Okay, but not excellent
Reviews.Author: Rustem Uvaliyev
Reviews.Content: Pros: looks good, works OK, long battery lifeCons: slow camera, screen hangs, didn't update over-the-air (received an update only when connecting to PC)

Reviews.Title: Razr
Reviews.Author: gary
Reviews.Content: I initially blame myself thinking I would purshasing the Motorola Razor Maxx not realizing there was difference between the Maxx and the Maxx HD. I received the cell phone and now I cannot use it because upon arrival a note was sent stating I cannot use it for Verizon or Pageplus networks. I now have a nice phone that can only be used by me as a paper weight. It was not clear prior to purchase or it would have been purchased for my use but maybe my daughters use on T-Mobile.

Reviews.Title: Should probably avoid...
Reviews.Author: CWestin
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Motorola Razr MAXX (not the HD model) JUST about a year ago. Well, it started out fine. The phone was nice, pretty powerful, responsive and suck. Everything was pretty acceptable. Then about 5-6 months later, the phone starts to get some real lag and some issues with performance. Applications, even factory loaded ones, like the Camera, will run ridiculously slow. When you click the camera app icon, the app will open, and it will take about ten seconds for the app to become usable. Then, if you switch over to movie mode, it takes another 5-10 seconds for it to switch modes, and also, when you tap the record button, it takes about as long to start recording. What is very very annoying. Most applications, both factory loaded and acquired from the Google Play store act this way. The only ones that really don't are the most simple applications. Then about8 months later I started noticing that the screen wasn't as accurate as it was when it was new. This was especially evident when typing text, both in the vertical and horizontal mode. Quite a few times per text, instead of the letter that you intended to be entered being entered, it would enter the letter to the left or right, and it just stayed that way.. Until, about 10-11 months after purchase, my phone started not holding a charge for long at all. It was to the point where I would walk out the door at 8am with a full charge, and by time I was getting off at 6pm, the battery would be about dead, giving me 20% and 10% and then finally the 0% Phone Shutting Down notifications. Also, when your battery dies with this phone, you can't simply plug it into a charger in immediately turn it on to use it. You must wait 5-10 minutes in order for it to reach a 5% charge for the phone to allow you to turn it on and function... Finally, about a week or so after I noticed this happening, one day I plugged in my phone to the charger, and noticed that it was charging very slow, if at all. So I figured I would leave it on there for a bit longer (this time when I initially plugged it in to charge, the battery was at 30%, not completely dead). BUT, when I came back a little bit later and picked up the phone to look at it, I noticed that the phone was very hot. To the point where it was uncomfortable to hold in the hand, and where you would NOT want to hold it to your head to use it. ALSO, I noticed that the battery indicator read 0%. Which was ridiculous, because when I plugged it in initially, it had a 30% charge... Needless to say, unplugging it resulted in the screen immediately going blank. After that, even plugged in, it wasn't responsive at all and would just get very very hot. So I called Verizon, and they replaced it.. Well, with the new one, the phone is responsive, though I've only had it for about a month.. The touch screen is inaccurate already, having the same problems texting, after only having it for a month. Also, a new issue with this one, it's constantly going in and out of 4G. Here in the Melbourne, FL area, we have a steady strong 4G LTE network. The last Razar MAXX constantly held a 4G connection. Now with this one I see it in 3G an AWEFUL lot. Also, the talk reception sucks at times now too...If you want to go with a Razr MAXX...... Good luck....

Reviews.Title: Very nice phone but shouldn't be anywhere NEAR $450 now
Reviews.Author: Sporty "Sporty"
Reviews.Content: I own this phone and it's been a great phone. I'm actually looking to upgrade but was very shocked to see the price of this thing at $450, half a grand! Not worth it at this point. I'd pay $300 but not $450 for it! Heck the HD is out and IT shouldn't be $650, not with the new ones coming out very soon. So wait till this thing comes down out of the stratosphere pricewise before buying it now.

Reviews.Title: Please Answer ASAP
Reviews.Author: xTheMechanic
Reviews.Content: Im very confused about this product. Some have said that this is a great phone and they specifically point out the battery. A few said that they got the xt910 instead. If someone has bought this phone or is buying this phone could you please inform me about this because I think this phone is better than the S3 but it will be a waste if it ends up being the Droid Razr and not the Droid Razr Maxx.So please message me ASAP

Reviews.Title: emy
Reviews.Author: emy
Reviews.Content: The best thing that has ever happened to the cell phone worldI love it. Infact i highly recommend it all.

Reviews.Title: purchase of Motorola maxx xt910
Reviews.Author: Stanislav
Reviews.Content: The phone which I ordered was delivered during 3 days. Everything ok, the mail was not harmed. So good job from the seller and delivery services. Anyway Motorola works good, the quality is equal the price. Battery is really good, it can hold nearly 4 days when you dont use data from cell network and use only wifi.

Reviews.Title: GSM
Reviews.Author: FGP
Reviews.Content: Make sure you realize this is a GSM phone--not compatible with Verizon Wireless's service.  I bought a CDMA version of this phone, though, and it's great.

Reviews.Title: SHORT LIFE
Reviews.Author: RAMON Z
Reviews.Content: THIS CELLPHONE ONLY WORK 5 MONTH, AFTER THAT DO NOT WORK ANYMORE. I THINK THE MANUFACTURE MUST BE MORE CAREFUL WITH THE QUALITY OF CONTROL OF THIS ITEM

Reviews.Title: Very good phone
Reviews.Author: luis
Reviews.Content: I think this is one the best price - quality phones in the market, althoug you can easily prefer S3, S4 or iPhone 5, for those who dont have that budget but still have a powerfull and good mobile, this is the one for you

Reviews.Title: unlocked phone for prepaid or cingular service
Reviews.Author: Mclaughlin
Reviews.Content: brand new factory phone with travel accesory kit includes adapters for worldwide travel.  does not work on verizon or sprint networks good replacement for prepaids and att&t;

Reviews.Title: fake add
Reviews.Author: Mariano Melgar
Reviews.Content: it is not a maxx razr, it is a xt910 phone. very bad ad, very ambiguous and confusing. super bad.
